name: Vegan Burgers with Grilled Vegetables
description: We can't get enough of vegan burgers around here! This vegan burger with grilled vegetables, sun-dried tomato mayonnaise, and arugula is our new summer favorite!
recipeIngredient: 2  vegan burger patties of your choice ((see recipe notes) )

recipeInstructions.text: Wash the bell peppers and the eggplant. Cut the eggplant into half slices and the mushrooms into slices. Cut the bell peppers and the red onion into strips.
recipeInstructions.name: Wash the bell peppers and the eggplant. Cut the eggplant into half slices and the mushrooms into slices. Cut the bell peppers and the red onion into strips.

recipeInstructions.text: Finely chop the garlic. Wash the fresh rosemary and thyme and roughly chop it. If it's easier for you, you could also use dried herbs.
recipeInstructions.name: Finely chop the garlic. Wash the fresh rosemary and thyme and roughly chop it. If it's easier for you, you could also use dried herbs.

recipeInstructions.text: Put everything in a big bowl and add the olive oil. Carefully stir until everything is covered with olive oil. Let it marinate for about 30 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Put everything in a big bowl and add the olive oil. Carefully stir until everything is covered with olive oil. Let it marinate for about 30 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: In the meantime, make the sun-dried tomato mayonnaise. Add the vegan mayonnaise and the sun-dried tomatoes to a blender or food processor. Blend until smooth.
recipeInstructions.name: In the meantime, make the sun-dried tomato mayonnaise. Add the vegan mayonnaise and the sun-dried tomatoes to a blender or food processor. Blend until smooth.

recipeInstructions.text: Place a grill pan over medium-high heat. Grill the vegetables until they're lightly brown and well-marked by the grill pan (this should take about 2-5 minutes depending on the thickness of the vegetables).
recipeInstructions.name: Place a grill pan over medium-high heat. Grill the vegetables until they're lightly brown and well-marked by the grill pan (this should take about 2-5 minutes depending on the thickness of the vegetables).

recipeInstructions.text: In a different pan, pan-fry the burger patties.
recipeInstructions.name: In a different pan, pan-fry the burger patties.

recipeInstructions.text: Place the whole wheat buns in the oven to warm them up a little bit.
recipeInstructions.name: Place the whole wheat buns in the oven to warm them up a little bit.

recipeInstructions.text: Evenly spread the sun-dried tomato mayonnaise on the buns, and place the arugula, the burger patty, and the grilled vegetables on top. Serve with homemade fries if you want. Enjoy!
